intent_atoms.description: Automate strict concurrency checks via Swift's --strict-concurrency=complete flag across build and test phases to enforce thread-safe concurrent design patterns.
Pre-push hook executes swift build and swift test with --strict-concurrency=complete, logs are published to Documentation/Quality with timestamps, and exits with status 1 if either command fails.
GitHub Actions CI runs strict concurrency checks on every pull request and push to main; workflow fails if either build or test command returns non-zero exit code.
Build and test logs show zero strict concurrency diagnostics (suppressed diagnostics do not count; all must be resolved).
CI uploads concurrency logs as workflow artifacts for historical tracking and failure investigation.
Documentation PRD is updated with links to passing logs, status transition from "Proposed" to "Automation Gate Established", and any deviations or special exemptions noted with justification.
All open items in the PRD's "Automation Alignment" section are resolved.
No regressions: existing CI gates (from A2, A6, A7, A8) remain operational; no breaking changes to build matrix or timeout settings.
Swift version must be 5.9+ for --strict-concurrency=complete flag support.

Strict concurrency checks are enforced via pre-push hook and GitHub Actions CI, but the existing Store implementation is not refactored; future changes must maintain thread safety without altering current architecture.
